comments.commentBody: For heaven's sake, you guys are reporting that Donald Trump has a "raw side" as if that's something that every THINKING person hasn't known about him already for years on end!  There is not now nor has there ever been anything DIGNIFIED about "the Donald" as any native New Yorker such as myself whose been subjected to his endless exploits for decades knows only too well.  He's leading the Republican field not because he has anything important to say but because his opponents are so abysmally bad that he simply "entertains" and nothing more.  How anyone can call themselves a Republican without any shame based on the field of candidates that party is putting forward is something I, for one, find immensely entertaining.  There's simply no bottom to the depths that they will go in perverting the facts and "the Donald" leads them all in this regard, he's their Pied Piper and THEY can have him.
Over a certain level of wealth it's impossible to go bankrupt. Bankrucpy laws were constructed to punish the poor and assuage the rich. Name all the bankrupt millionaires now sleeping under bridges?
I think he's more like Caligula than Nero really.  Nero was at least, so it is said, musically talented.
unfortunately he is news and its up to us to ignore the media stories.
Ignore Donald Trump.  Then he will be ignored and forgotten by the American public.

Algorithms are built to tackle specific problems and more often than not, when built using adequate data, can not only vastly outperform humans but perform almost miraculously in terms of predicting outcomes. Neural networks, for example have been for the past two decades silently altering the world around us almost imperceptibly. Today we have the ability to pretty much eliminate 90 % jobs through automation algorithms , however, the political will at the corporate and national level for such seismic shift is non existent. Face it, the vast majority among us is ill prepared for the modern world and this realization is amply manifested in the disparaging comments above
He started a multi-multi-millionaire and (after a bailout from his siblings) turned into a billionaire. He's a self made myth.
As far as we know..
Berlusconi was the longest serving post-war  Prime  Minister  of Italy. Italians loved him. I think Trump would happily embrace your comparison.

Thin skinned, thin hair; pretty much, your classic bloviator.
He's like Berlusconi, minus the underage prostitutes.
There's an old Jewish imprecation that goes: "...you should build a house with 20 bedrooms and be found dead in every one of them..." There's something Trumpian about that.
Trump is a male version of Sarah Palin but not as physically attractive.

Fascinating how the NYT ordered an article in which they tried to unearth every morsel that might disparage Trump, as if the newspaper was in the pocket of HRC. When are we going to read an article about every morel of dirt from all the legal testimonies of the other candidates, Reps and Dems?

From the photo, head down like an ashamed convict, to the tone and content of this article this is a clear manipulation to destroy Trump because he is ahead on the polls and a clear dancer for the boring and weak and power hungry HRC machine.

Well, if you want a boot camp drill instructor in the White house, Trump's probably not your candidate. A competent drill instructor is, after all, responsible for his or her trainees' health and welfare. This guy is so ridiculously tough-minded that he'd likely be a disaster in THAT position.
One thing I have to say for him, though, is when it comes to epitomising the ridiculousness of reality TV, Trump is truly without peer. But is that what you'd want governing this country and representing it to the rest of the world?
Thank you for giving him the air time.  Yes, he's a distraction at best,  but it's always good to have a safety.

Hahahahahaha! You guys keep giving him air time. The joke's on you!
He is a distraction at best, and is pretty much guaranteeing that a democrat will win the White House next year. Run Donald Run!

Health care shouldn't be a market commodity in the first place.

The fact that insurance companies, the pharmaceutical industry, hospital and providers are making a profit from other people's misery is abominable on its face.

Health care should be a given, and it should be national and universal.

As valiant as they are the Kurds aren't able to take care of ISIS on their own. We need Turkey, and possibly even Iran which has its own problem with the Kurds.  Our President shouldn't sell out the Kurds and I'm sure he has no intention of doing so, but unless American boots are to be placed on Syrian soil (!) we need our allies to play nice and recognize who rye real enemy is.
"who THE real enemy is."

" told reporters on Tuesday that the deal was not entirely at the expense of the Syrian Kurds, who could benefit from what he called a shift in Turkish policy toward them."

Not entirely at the expense of the Syrian Kurds.

The words bear repeating.

Not entirely at the expense of the Syrian Kurds.

The words have a nice parsed Beltway rythm, eh? What a well phrased sell out.

Not entirely at the expense of the Syrian Kurds.

The strategically irrelvant, who fought with such distinction the Obama administration was embarrassed into doing the minimal against the JV. The only combatants in the mess who have acted with distinction.

Sold out for a nonsense policyless policy. What a despicable administration.

Um. So are you suggesting said lawyer whip out a boob and start pumping at the table?

Leaky boobs don't wait for no one, not even a self deluded "demigod" like The Donald (Duck)

Calgarth - Now there is a white male sixty year old taking the deposition. He has bph, you know, that have-to-pee disease advertised on TV. Prostate problems. Any other medical problem. He says he has to take a break. Trump objects. The man says "medical break". Trump says, "OK". Note the similarities? Difference? No, didn't think you would.

@Ozark Homesteader: You make two excellent points. Remember how the Republicans touted George W. Bush as "America's first MBA president?"

As for the milk-engorged breasts, she should have whipped them out and squirted him in the face.

Oh, com'on! Breast pumps are there so that you *don't have to take a break during a high-stakes, videotaped deposition -- not so that you *do! "Disgusting" may be the wrong word for this particular play, but "ridiculous" seems about right, and I don't blame Trump for being annoyed. And as to testifying for hours at depositions: they are set up to make people touchy and irritable.

I used to think what most of your other commenters do: "blowhard," "idiot," "bloviator," etc. But Trump is putting other candidates' feet to the fire, and he's putting a point on some of the fears and resentments of people who are largely unhappy with the way things are going, here and abroad. These misgivings are not wholly illegitimate; but everyone else running seems to be just dancing around them. It may be good to have the issues forced, even though the rhetoric is hot. At least a good debate ensues.

Trump would be just about right if he'd dial it back by half a click or so. I'll be eager to see if he can calibrate it. It used to be I'd put it past him. Now, maybe not --
But not critical thinking

MTF Tobin—Triple doubles in basketball are far, far more rare than double doubles, so it's strange that you would be more familiar with the former. When a triple double happens it's news; double doubles happen every day during the NBA season.
Nothing is more inappropriate than anything that comes out of Trump's mouth  Trump is certainly not professional there or elsewhere

What's disgusting about breast milk?

People need breaks in depositions. Trump and his lawyers were being jerks and not consenting to a break, so opposing counsel showed him a breast pump. BFD.

Yes, remember his people in Hawaii?
Why hasn't this buffoon been been thoroughly derided regarding all the lies he told on just this one subject?

DONALD TRUMP:
Well, I have people that actually have been studying it and they cannot believe what they’re finding.

MEREDITH VIEIRA:
You have people now out there searching– I mean, in Hawaii?

DONALD TRUMP:
Absolutely. And they cannot believe what they’re finding. And I’m serious—
Just have the president release his records. The reason this goes on is because he hasn't.
The President released his birth certificate years ago. Time for The Donald to release his.

If there's a man in public life who is less qualified to be our President than Donald Trump it would have to be O.J. Simpson (albeit not Homer). Personally I'm still waiting for him to present his "evidence" that our current chief executive was not born in the United States. As to that, I'm still waiting for him to be indicted on charges of libel.

No, Trump is not just like any politician because The Don is so self-absorbed that he would not even deign to listen to stories of actual hardship or to opposing views.  While I doubt he will ever hold office, much less the Presidency, his prominence is still destructive.  He promotes fear and stereotyping of immigrants, moneylust, illogical thinking and rejects introspection and compassion.  We should all tell Trump, " You're fired!" and move on to more constructive individuals.

And worried about American jobs?  He outsource all his products like ties to China and clothes to Mexico.  When asked why since he is so "wealthy" and could take a little less profit to be a role model he answered "why would I do that Im a businessman"  and "china made me do it"
A breath of fresh air?  He doesn't care about problems, solutions or America.  He only cares about the sound of his own voice bloviating.  He also lies as well
You seem to be confusing "the public" with 24 percent of people willing to identify themselves as Republicans.

Harry,
Did you mean a "fresh case of bad breath."? Okay, I agree.
You can't be serious.  he outsources all his jobs.  His ties are made in China, his clothes in Mexico and his other brands who knows where?  He is part of the problem and not the solution to anything
